Description of incident: "What Happened? On March 8, 2017, we discovered that our company was the victim of an email spoofing attack on January 18, 2017, by an individual pretending to be our Chief Financial Officer. A request was made from what appeared to be legitimate Schurman Retail Group ("SRG") email address for all 2016 SRG employee Form W-2 information.  Unfortunately, copies of all 2016 employee W-2 forms were provided before we discovered that the request was fraudulent.  We have been working tirelessly to investigate and to mitigate the impact of the attack since we discovered the fraudulent nature of the request.What Information Was Involved? A file, including a copy of your IRS Tax Form W-2, was sent in response to the fraudulent email.  An IRS Tax Form W-2 includes the following categories of information: (1) the employee's name; (2) the employee's address; (3) the employee's Social Security number; and (4) the employee's wage information. Other than the information contained on the IRS Tax Form W-2, no personal financial information was emailed to the external email account."More Information: https://oag.ca.gov/ecrime/databreach/reports/sb24-67056
